intro: Hedraiophyllum, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Hedraiophyllum has small, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
